adventure_overview: Water is an important force in our lives. It can be as gentle as a spring sun-shower or as powerful as a hurricane. All living things need water to live, but we use water for more than just survival. In this Adventure, you will learn where the water you use comes from and how to conserve it. Adventure Safety Moment Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved.

requirements.text: Discover where the water in your home comes from.

activities.name: H2O Discovery Day
activities.description: Visit a river or other body of water to learn where your drinking water comes from.

activities.name: My Water
activities.description: Create a poster showing the water cycle for your community.

activities.name: Water Expert
activities.description: Have a professional who works in the water treatment industry speak to the den about where water used at home comes from.

requirements.text: Discuss how water can become polluted.

activities.name: Aqua Pollution
activities.description: Cub Scouts  demonstrate  how pollution can enter our groundwater.

activities.name: River Rangers: Detecting Water Contaminants
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn how water can become polluted.

activities.name: Water Warriors: Pollution Busters
activities.description: Cub Scouts  identify  which items contribute to polluting water and which will help keep water clean.

requirements.text: Share some ways you can conserve water in your home.

activities.name: How Much Water Do I Use?
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn about wasting water in their home.

activities.name: Splash Savers Memory Match
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn about water conservation by playing a card matching game.

activities.name: Water Conservation Word Search
activities.description: Cub Scouts will find water conservation-related words in a word search puzzle.

requirements.text: Discover how water in your community is treated to become safe to drink.

activities.name: Clean H2O Creations
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn about filtering water by making their own water filter.

activities.name: Hiking Filters
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn how a backpacking water filter works.
